questions.text: AMH leads to regression of mullerian ducts around what gestational age?
questions.solution:
By the 6th week of development, if the embryo is chromosomally XY, cells in the sex cords in the medulla will grow and become sertoli cells, under the influence of SRY, and the cortex will disappear.

The sertoli cells will start to produce AMH, which will halt the development of the paramesonephric ducts and eventually cause rapid regression during the 8th to 10th week of development.

Remnants in the males include:

Prostatic utricle

Rarley, a genetic male due to an AMH malfunction will have persistence of the mullerian ducts (and thus a uterus and fallopian tubes will develop) a condition called Hernia uteri inguinale.

questions.text: DHT is required for development of which of the following
questions.solution:
• Complete development of male external genitalia and differentiation of the prostate requires the conversion of testosterone to dihydrotestosterone (DHT), via the action of the intracellular enzyme 5α-reductase.
  • The genital tubercle and the labioscrotal swellings are highly sensitive to DHT, being rich in both androgen receptors and 5α-reductase activity.
  • Testosterone and DHT are the major steroids that bind to the androgen receptor (AR)
  • In some target organs, such as the prostate, the main androgen bound to the AR is DHT, while in other tissues, such as the wolffian duct or testis, testosterone in the preferred ligand.

questions.text: All of the following can lead to endometriosis in a teenager, an age when endometriosis is rare, except
questions.solution:
Endometriosis is rare in premenarcheal girls but may be identified in half or more of the adolescents and young women under 20 with complaints of chronic pelvic pain or dyspareunia. Most cases in young women are associated with

  *  Mullerian anomalies

  *  Cervical agenesis

  *  Vaginal obstruction

Fewer than 5% of women who require surgery for endometriosis are postmenopausal.

Most have history of receiving estrogen therapy

choices.text: Dysmenorrhea begins before onset of menstrual flow and persists throughout menses
Deeply infiltrating disease may be associated with dyschezia
The severity of symptoms correlate with severity of endometriosis
It is the most common complaint

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding dysmenorrhea observed in endometriosis?
questions.solution:
• The intensity of pain associated with deeply infiltrating endometriosis relates to the depth of penetration and to the proximity or direct invasion of nerves
  • The severity of endometriosis does not correlate with the number and severity of symptoms
  • Women with advanced disease may have few or no symptoms and those with minimal or mild disease may have incapacitating pain.

choices.text: Extracavitary but not reaching the endometrium

questions.text: FIGO type 3 fibroid corresponds to

choices.text: Central hemorrhagic infarction of the myoma
Pain is the hallmark of this condition

questions.text: Which of the following is false about red degeneration of fibroids?
questions.solution:
• Red degeneration is due to central infarction of fibroid, so infection is not the etiology, hence antibiotics are not required.
  • Main mode of management is fluids and analgesics
  • Observed during late pregnancy
  • Associated with central hemorrhagic infarction of the myoma
  • Pain is the hallmark of this condition, occasionally associated with rebound tenderness, mild fever, leukocytosis, nausea, and vomiting.
  • Usually pain is the only symptom and resolution follows rest and analgesic treatment

questions.text: A 35 year old nulliparous woman presents with complaints of menorrhagia and dysmenorrhea since two years. On per vaginum examination her uterus is uniformly enlarged, 10 weeks size of gravid uterus, tender, firm in consistency. You make diagnosis of adenomyosis. Which of the following go against your diagnosis?
questions.solution:
• Ectopic presence of endometrial glands within the myometrium
  • Usually seen in multiparous women
  • Chief presenting complaints are menorrhagia and congestive dysmenorrhea
  • On examination uterus is mostly less than 12 weeks size, although it can be larger too.
  • Uterus is tender in adenomyosis while mostly fibromyomas are nontender, which makes this a differential point
  • Uterus can be uniformly enlarged in both conditions, although most fibromyomas present with irregularly enlarged uterus.

choices.text: Only FSH rises, LH remains same
Miscarriage rates with clomiphene are similar to spontaneous conception cycles
Reversible blurred vision by clomiphene is due to its mydriatic cation

questions.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect about clomiphene citrate
questions.solution:
• The rise is FSH is accompanied by a similar rise in serum LH levels
  • Miscarriage rates of 13% to 25% are reported, similar to the spontaneous miscarriage rate and those observed in infertile women undergoing IVF
  • Hot flushes occur in up to 10% of women taking CC
  • The mydriatic action of CC may cause reversible blurred vision in a similar number
  • The multiple pregnancy rate is less than 10 and OHSS is rare
  • The putative increased risk of ovarian cancer reported to be associated with the use of CC for more than 12 months has led CC to be licensed for just 6 months of use in some countries.

questions.text: Drug of choice for complicated falciparum malaria during pregnancy is
questions.solution:
DOC for chemoprophylaxis of chloroquine sensitive malaria – Chloroquine + Proguanil

DOC for chemoprophylaxis of chloroquine resistant malaria - mefloquine

DOC for the treatment of uncomplicated falciparum malaria – Quinine + Clindamycin

DOC for the treatment of complicated falciparum malaria - Artesunate

DOC for the treatment of non falciparum malaria - Chloroquine

choices.text: Manage conservatively as acyclovir is contraindicated during pregnancy

questions.text: 28 year old woman presents @ 32 weeks of pregnancy with chickenpox rashes since last 12 hours. What is your advice on this scenario?
questions.solution:
Significant exposure with a case of chicken pox during pregnancy in the infectious period – Check for immune status with past history of chicken pox and VZ IgG Ab- Give varicella zoster immunoglobulin if she is non immune if less than 10 days since contact

For woman presenting with rashes- Start oral acyclovir within 24 hours of onset of rash

choices.text: Reinitiate ART with regimen based on prior therapy
Do drug resistance testing & initiate ART according to the sensitivity
Do viral load testing & initiate ART if viral load is > 50 copies/mL
Initiate ART with 2 NRTI & 1 PI irrespective of the previous regimen used

questions.text: Identify the correct statement regarding anteretroviral therapy in a pregnant women with history of prior ART exposure
questions.solution:
• Recommendations on ART
  • All HIV positive pregnant women should be put on ART, Continue lifelong irrespective of CD4 count & viral load
  • Atleast 3 drugs should be given -> 2 NRTI + 1 PI
  • Preferred Drugs
  • NRTI (Nucleoside Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitor)
    1. Abacavir
    2. Lamivudine
    3. Tenofovir
    4. Emtricitabine
  • PI – Protease Inhibitor – Atazanavir
  • Ritonavir
  • II - Integrase Inhibitor – Raltegravir

choices.text: More severe than D allo immunisation
98% of the population are kell negative
Most common cause is blood transfusion
They do not cause hemolytic disease of newborn

questions.text: Identify the wrong statement about kell allo immunisation
questions.solution:
• Alloimmunisation in Minor Antigens
  • Most common minor antigen causing sensitisation -> kell
  • Other potential antigens causing alllo immunisation -> Duffy (Fya)
  • Kidd (jka)
  • MNS
  • No risk of alloimmunisation -> Lewis Antigen Lea, Leb
  • I antigen
  • Duffy Fyb
  • Most cases of Rhesus Alloimmunisation occur during pregnancy
  • 90% of Kell alloimmunisation are due to blood transfusion
  • Reaction is severe and rapid in kell alloimmunisation-> Destroys percusor RBC's in bone marrow

choices.text: Superfisial and deep transverse perineal muscles

questions.text: All of the following structures are cut in mediolateral episiotomy except?
questions.solution:
Structures cut in mediolateral episiotomy

1.Posterior vaginal wall

2.Superficial transverse perinei

3.Deep transverse perinei

4.Bulbospongiosus(Part of levator ani)

5.Fascia covering these muscles

6.Transverse perineal branch of pudendal vessels

7.Subcutaneous tissue and skin

questions.text: A 24years old woman visits labour casualty at 37weeks of gestation with mild labour pains for 10hours and cervix is persistently 1cm dilated but non effaced. What will be the next appropriate management?

choices.text: Intracavilary brachytherapy followed by external beam RT

questions.text: 1A 55year old woman was found to have a carcinoma cervix FIGO staging 3b. What would be the management?
which of the following peak is responsible for ovulation?
questions.solution:
Menstrual Cycle:

  • Normal duration __________ (28±7 days)
  • Average 28 days
  • D1 – First day of menstruation
  • D14 – Day of ovulation in a 28 day cycle
  • Menstrual cycle is divided into two phases


Ovulation

  • Process by which mature graffian follicle ruptures and releases the secondary oocyte..
  • Occurs on 14th day of menstrual cycle.
  • Size of the dominant follicle on the Day of ovulation is 20 mm
  • LH surge begins 36 hours before ovulation
  • LH peaks 12 hours prior to ovulation

questions.text: Correct order of pubertal development is
questions.solution:
Stages of Pubertal development:

  • Acceleration of growth, Thelarche, pubarche, menarche
  • Thelarche: Breast Budding
  • Pubarche: Appearance of pubic hair
  • Menarche: Onset of menses
  • Complete pubertal sequence requires a period of 4.5 years
  • Menarche occurs 2.6 years after onset of puberty

choices.text: Breast feeding is better avoided in all COVID infected women until recovery
Breast feeding should be encouraged only in asymptomatic COVID positive women and not in symptomatic
Expressed breast milk feed would not be ideal as virus is shed in breast milk
Breast feeding and Rooming-In should be encouraged regardless of Covid status

questions.text: What is your advice on breast feeding in COVID infected women
questions.solution:
Post natal Care in COVID patient:

  • Allow rooming in, skin to skin care
  • Support breast feeding
  • COVID-19 infection is not a contra indication to breast feeding
  • Severely ill patient – Express and Feed

questions.text: A Midwifery was examining a Pregnant Mother in Labour. Suddenly She noticed a Cord lying outside the introitus. Next line of Management is
questions.solution:
Cord Prolapse – Management:

1.Replace cord inside vagina

2.Minimal handling of cord loops

3.Presenting part should be elevated either manually or by filling the bladder

4.Put mother in knee chest position or head down tilt preferably in left lateral position

5.Immediate delivery

questions.text: G3P2L2 @ 39 weeks with spontaneous labour pain comes with Cx 2 cm dilated, 50% effaced, medium consistency, anterior in position with station @-2. Bishop score is
Chemotherapy for dysgerminoma is:
questions.solution:
• BEP regimen is the treatment of choice for germ cell tumors of the ovary
  • Cisplatin and Paclitaxel are the first choice drugs for epithelial ovarian cancers and endometrial cancer

questions.text: pH of vagina in the reproductive age group is
Strawberry vagina is a feature of
questions.solution: Strawberry vagina and strawberry cervix are features of  trichomonas vaginalis

questions.text: Most common site for genital tuberculosis is
questions.solution:
Genital Tuberculosis:

  • Genital tuberculosis is almost always a secondary infection,with M/c primary sites being lungs > lymph nodes > abdomen
  • Route of spread – Hematogenous
  • M/C site is B/L fallopian tubes (in fallopian tubes – M/c Affected part = Ampulla and M/c encountered pathology is endosalpingitis)
  • M/c age group = 20 -30 years (28 years specifically)
  • M/c symptom = Infertility
  • If patient conceives spontaneously, ectopic pregnancy is the most likely outcome

questions.solution: Management of CIN:

questions.text: The most common gynecological malignancy associated with HNPCC is
questions.solution:
• LYNCH 11 syndrome
  • Risk of Ca endometrium is 60%

Ca colon – 54%

Ca ovary – 10%

  • Surveillance
  • pelvic exam, TVS, endometrial sampling annually or prophylactic TAH + BSO

questions.text: Uterine pain during labour is carried by
questions.solution:
Innervation of uterus

Sympathetic – T10 to L2

                Superior hypogastric plexus (a) Presacral N

Parasympathetic – S2,3,4

Sympathetic + Parasympathetic forms -> Inferior hypogastric / Pelvic plexus which further divides into three plexus as follows.

  • Vesical plexus
  • Middle rectal plexus
  • Uterovaginal plexus also called frankenhauser plexus

üUterine Pain – carried by T10,11,12, L1

üCervix  & Upper vaginal pain – S2,3,4 (Pelvic splanchnic N)

üLower Vagina – Pudendal N

choices.text: Columnar epithelium moving out & onto the ecto Cx
Columnar epithelium extending to the vagina

questions.text: Eversion is
questions.solution:
Cervix:

  • Divided into Supra vaginal and Infra vaginal parts
  • Internal OS – corresponds to UV fold of peritoneum
  • External OS – Before child birth – Oval opening
  • - After child birth – Transverse slit
  • Ecto Cx – Non keratinized stratified squamous epithelium
  • Endo Cx – Columnar epithelium (Single layer / mucin secreting)
  • Eversion – Columnar epithelium moving out & onto the ecto Cx
  • Cx has very little smooth muscle & mainly has collagen, elastin & proteoglycan

choices.text: Cardiac anomaly is the most common associated anomaly
Trisomy 21 is the most common aneuploidy

questions.text: Identify the wrong statement about single umbilical A
questions.solution:
Single umbilical artery

Incidence-0.4 to 0.6%

Increases with maternal age and tobacco use

80% of SUA are isolated

20% associated with anomalies or aneuploidies

Cardiac anomaly-7% (Most common)

Renal anomaly – 5%

Aneuploidy – 4%

Most common aneuploidy :Trisomy18>13,21

questions.text: Most common organism causing bartholins abcess is
questions.solution: • Most common organism causing bartholin’s abcess is gonococcus.

questions.text: Sympathetic supply to the ovary is derived from
questions.solution:
Ovaries:

  • Pair of pearly white structures(3X2X1cm)
  • Waldeyer fossa – Ovarian fossa
  • Divided into Outer cortex / Inner medulla
  • Lined by a Single layer of cuboidal epithelium supported by a connective tissue condensation – tunica albuginea

Nerve supply:

  • Sympathetic –T10
  • Para sympathetic-Vagus

questions.text: Development of Recombinant HPV Vaccine is based on Which Viral Protein?
questions.solution:
Vaccination

HPV 2 –HPV 16,18

HPV 4 – HPV 6,11,16,18

HPV 9– HPV 6,11,16,18,31,33,45,52,58

Ideal age – 11 to 12 years

Doses – 3 for above 15 years and 2 for below 15 years

questions.text: The causative agent associated with this Image?
questions.solution:
• Zika Virus:

–RNA Virus

–Primarily transmitted by mosquito bite

–Mode of Transmission:

  • Mosquito bite
  • Sexual transmission is also possible
  • Vertical transmission

*  Virus persists in body fluids for months

  • Symptoms:

–Rash, Fever, Headache

–Arthralgia

–Conjunctivitis

–Guillian barre syndrome

  • Fetus can be severely infected whether or not mother is symptomatic
  • Overall fetal infection rate – 6% (5-15%)
  • Anomaly rate in 1st trimester – 15% if infection occurs in 1st trimester
  • Congenital Zika Syndrome:

–Microcephaly   Intracranial calcifications

–Lissencephaly    Occular abnormalities

–Ventriculomegaly   Congenital contractures

  • No treatment or vaccine is available

questions.text: The Position of the Foetus in this Image is
Identify the Obstetric Grip
Fouchette is formed by the fusion of
questions.solution:
Labia Minora:

Thin tissue fold medial to labia majora

Superiorly it divides into 2 lamella

Upper lamella fuse to form prepuce

Lower lamella fuse to form frenulum

Inferior lamella fuse to form fouchette

Blood Supply of vagina

  • Posterior wall – Middle rectal .A
  • Distal wall – Internal pudendal. A

choices.text: The main solid content of amniotic fluid is lipid
Liquor is 98% made up of water
Liquor has hormones like prolactin & insulin

questions.text: Identify the false statement about amniotic fluid
questions.solution:
Constitution

  • Water – 98%
  • Glucose – 20 mg%
  • Urea – 30 mg%
  • Protein – 0.3mg%
  • NPN (Non-Proteinaceous Nitrogen) – 30mg%
  • Uric acid – 4mg%
  • Creatinine – 2mg%
  • Lipid – 50mg%
  • Hormones – Prolactin/Insulin/Renin

questions.text: The most common cause for oligohydramnios is
questions.solution:
Oligohydramnios

  • AFI < 5cm
  • SDP < 2cm

Causes

  • PROM -> Most common cause
  • Post dated pregnancy -> 2nd most common cause
  • B/L Renal agenesis -> most common cause for severe oligohydramnios
  • Preeclampsia/Vascular disease
  • Utero placental insufficiency
  • AR PCKD (Autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease)
  • AD PCKD -> Adult disease
  • Multiple dysplastic kidney (MCDK)
  • Bladder outlet obstruction
  • Mega cystitis / Microcolon intestinal hypoperistalsis syndrome
  • Posterior urethral valve
  • Urethral atresia/stenosis
  • Persistent cloaca
  • Sirenomelia

choices.text: Fetal RBCs are nucleated & megaloblastic in early pregnancy
Adult type Hb appears only after 24 weeks of gestation
Fetal Hb is completely replaced by adult Hb at birth
Fetal Hb has increased affinity for O2

questions.text: Identify the false statement about fetal hematopoeisis
questions.solution:
Fetal Blood:

  • Early pregnancy – Megaloblastic & nucleated
  • Near term –Normoblastic
  • Up to 24 weeks – only HbF (α2γ2)
  • From 24 weeks onwards – Adult Hb (α2β2) + Fetal Hb
  • At term – 75 to 80% is HbF type
  • Other types of Hb found are grower 1,2, Portland
  • Fetal Hb is completely replaced by adult Hb between 6-12 months after birth
  • Fetal Hb has low affinity for 2,3 DPG & increased affinity for O2

questions.text: Which of the following is the most common type of Hb in fetal circulation
questions.solution:
Types of Hb seen in fetal circulation

  • Yolk Sac – Gower 1,2, Portland
  • Liver – HbF from 10 weeks
  • Bone Marrow – HbA from 24 weeks

choices.text: Blood group antigens appear as early as 1st trimester
Cord blood levels of iron & ferritin are higher than in maternal blood
Life span of fetal RBC is more than adult RBC
Fetal Hb is resistant to alkali denaturation

questions.text: Identify the false statement about fetal RBC
questions.solution:
• Fetal Hb is resistant to alkali
  • Fetoplacental blood volume at term is 125ml/kg
  • Blood group antigens appear as early as 38 days after conception
  • Life span of fetal RBC is 80days (2/3 of adult RBC) & 90 days at term
  • Cord blood levels of iron, ferritin, B12 & folate are higher than maternal blood

questions.text: False statement about bartholin's gland is
questions.solution:
Bartholins glands (Paired):

  • Greater vestibular glands
  • 0.5 to 1cm gland
  • 1.5 to 2cm duct
  • Ducts open @ 5 & 7o’clock position
  • Minor vestibular glands open along hart line
